message.content:
<<<api>>>: ExecutorService
<<<code>>>: public class ThreadPoolExample {
    private static final ExecutorService threadPool = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(10);

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Runnable task = () -> {
            try {
                while (true) {
                    System.out.println("Task is running");
                    Thread.sleep(1000);
                }
            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        };

        threadPool.execute(task);

        // Prevent the JVM from shutting down
        while (true) {
            try {
                Thread.sleep(1000);
            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we create a fixed thread pool with 10 threads using Executors.newFixedThreadPool(10). We then define a task that will run indefinitely, printing "Task is running" every second. We submit this task to the thread pool using threadPool.execute(task). Finally, we prevent the JVM from shutting down by adding an infinite loop in the main method. This loop does nothing but sleep for a second at a time, effectively keeping the JVM alive without consuming too much CPU.
